conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to join your community and contribute academically and to school life. I’m submitting my formal application and would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. However, School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). Since each school has capacity 1, applying immediately to School_C risks rejection if higher-priority students apply there. In contrast, School_A and School_B rank me 1st, meaning an immediate application would almost certainly secure a match. Among those, School_A is higher on my true preference list than School_B (3rd vs 5th). To maximize my outcome given the one-shot accept/reject nature of an [APPLY], I will apply to School_A now to lock in a strong guaranteed option rather than gamble on School_C.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing your submission, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We would be excited to have you join our community.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and no other applicants this round. Accepting now secures our top-choice match and avoids the risk of losing Student_E to another school (Student_E ranks School_C and School_D above School_A). Since we cannot do better than #1, immediate acceptance is optimal.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Although School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_E and Student_B), applying immediately gives me the best chance before the seat is taken. Even if I’m rejected due to higher-priority applicants, I can pivot next round to School_C where I’m ranked 2nd. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to School_B to encourage them to hold/choose me if possible.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_C is #3 on School_B’s true priority list. Student_E (#1) and Student_B (#2) do not currently have offers from us; Student_E ranks School_B last and is unlikely to apply, while Student_B ranks School_B second and may apply later if not accepted by School_A. Given quota=1, accepting Student_C now risks losing a higher-priority Student_B, but rejecting could leave us unmatched if Student_B never comes. Since Student_C has School_B as first choice and is applying with commitment, securing a solid match now is safer than waiting for an uncertain higher-priority applicant. Therefore accept.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions committee. I’m Student_D, and School_C is one of my top choices. I’m very interested in joining your community and would be excited to contribute academically and to school activities. I would like to formally apply for your available seat.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have relatively low priority there (4th), and several students rank it highly (A and C also have B as #1; C has B as #1; A has B as #1). School_C is my #2 and I have better priority there (3rd), while only Student_E ranks School_C first and Student_A ranks it second. Applying to School_C in round 1 maximizes my chance of securing a high-ranked option rather than risking rejection at School_B and then facing stronger competition later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_C. After reviewing applications received this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your time and wish you the best in your placement process.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority ranking is B > C > D > E > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from D, A, and B. Since quota is 1, accepting D now would forgo the chance to accept B, who is my top priority and has already applied. Therefore I should reject D to preserve the seat for a higher-priority candidate (B).

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A and I’m very interested in School_C. Thank you for your time and consideration.

To maximize my chance of securing a high-ranked match quickly, I will apply to School_C in round 1.

Therefore, I must reject Student_A now to avoid filling capacity with my lowest-priority acceptable candidate while a higher-priority candidate is available.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the academic environment and opportunities your school offers. I would be ready to commit and contribute positively to the community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and have also received applications from Student_D (#3) and Student_A (#5). Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top choice and is feasible since Student_B has School_C as their 3rd preference but signals readiness to commit; delaying risks losing them to School_A or School_B (their higher preferences) if they apply there next. Therefore, accept Student_B now.

I have low priority at School_E (last), but since it is still available, an immediate, committed application is my best chance; if rejected, I can pivot to School_D next round where I have top priority.
